formalText: Patient name is Audrey.
Audrey says she "feels quite young and better than most women in their 20s"
Her ID says she is 35.
Audrey the odd is what her sister calls her.
At end of conversation, Audrey stopped being cooperative and said "I want to talk to the head person
I'm fed up with talking to the old nag rag"
She came into the emergency clinic today.
The GP sent Audrey to see me
She says she came in because "There's important stuff in there really important stuff"
She has come to see the doctor's places (hospitals) and things like that because they have clever people.
Her "really important work" is
for World hunger.
She gets clues from the paper about what to do.
For about a week she has been
figuring out the numbers.
She finds in the papers the football results adds them together and finds something on that page number
The number corresponds to numbers on her chart at home.
She claims it is a cure for world hunger
God talks to her and tells her she is doing a great job.
She hears him in her ears.
rather than from inside her head.
Says  he's a big guy with a big beard
who she calls beardie and sir
Says, "He tells me I'm fantastic
how great I am for doing this and that I should show it to people"
She sent copies of things to the pope in the Archbishop of Canterbury
When asked, "Have you ever had anything like this before in your life where you felt full of energy and lots of bright ideas?"
She replied, "No, no, it's not happened before"
And times in her life where she kind of been the opposite,a bit down in the dumps she said
"Sometimes well, I have been low sometimes when I was younger a long time ago"
The doctor put her on Prozac but she says it didn't do anything
Doesn't remember when she was on Prozac and what dose
Asked, "What's brought this on?" and she said,
"Okay, and he just came to me one day
He just came to me, and I started noticing connections with numbers and things".
She has not taken any prescribed medications besides the Prozac in the past?
She has a small business with her sister selling Pottery.
She is a Potter.
Just part-time.
Her sister Libby recommended the doctor because she said to Audrey that she was bonkers.
When asked, "Does anyone in your family have things like this?", she said,
No, no, it's just me.
They're not really that clever, you know.
When asked about sleep, she says "No, I haven't had time to sleep now"
because she "doesn't need it"
She has all this enthusiasm from God
and energy inside her.
When asked about her thoughts, she is thinking lots and lots of ideas
they are going fast
Regarding her self-esteem,
she feels fantastic, "you know, cuz God's telling me right I am yeah, okay, and I'm doing a really good job"
She feels as if she is more clever than perhaps other people.
Asked about physical health and any problems which she said she was
Physically fine.
